alert.note: Alert for Clackamas; Marion (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 27 at 3:37PM PST until January 31 at 1:35PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Oregon... Pudding River at Aurora affecting Marion and Clackamas Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO EARLY WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Pudding River at Aurora. * WHEN...From late tonight to early Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Above 24.0 feet, expect considerable flooding of low-lying agricultural land and secondary roads from the Whiskey Hill area downstream to the confluence with the Molalla River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:00 PM PST Saturday the stage was 21.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 21.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 23.7 feet late Monday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 22.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Sunday morning at 600 AM PST.
